summary: This is an email from a U.S. Attorney's Office employee to a colleague regarding a potential award from the Palm Beach Chief of Police for work on the Epstein case. The sender expresses concern about accepting the award if the case 'blows up again' and seeks approval.

persons.name: Chief of Police of the City of Palm Beach
persons.context: Wishes to recognize the email sender and recipient for their work on the Epstein case with an award at a ceremony on December 15, 2008.

events.title: Planned Police Award Ceremony
events.description: The Chief of Police of Palm Beach plans to hold an awards ceremony to recognize the email sender and recipient for their work on the Epstein case, without mentioning the case by name.
personsInvolved: Chief of Police of the City of Palm Beach

keyFacts: In November 2008, the Palm Beach Chief of Police sought to award federal prosecutors for their work on the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The federal prosecutor expressed concern that the 'Epstein case may blow up again,' indicating ongoing sensitivity and potential for renewed scrutiny.
The award was to be given without mentioning the Epstein case by name, highlighting the discreet nature of the recognition.
